resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
edrevo opened a new pull request #10083:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10083


   The functions that calculated job status from the task status was aggregating all of the partition locations. This is incorrect. Only the partitions of the last stage should be collected.
   
   @andygrove, could you confirm that my assumption that the output of any query is contained in the last stage? If there is a possibility of having multiple output stages, then this fix is incorrect.


--

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I just ran benchmarks for the first time in a while and I see duplicate entries for group by keys.

 

For example, query 1 has "group by l_returnflag, l_linestatus" and I see multiple results with l_returnflag = 'A' and l_linestatus = 'F'.

comments.body: I tracked down the PR that introduced the regression in the original repo and it was [https://github.com/ballista-compute/ballista/pull/574]

I'm now very confused about this issue. I have been working on debugging it and now it suddenly is working, so I don't know if it is an intermittent bug or not. When it works correctly, the query returns 4 rows and takes ~13 seconds for me. When it does not work it returns many times more rows and takes 3x as long.

It would be good to get a second pair of eyes on this.

I tracked this down and there are two separate bugs:

1. We are getting RepartitionExec in the plan which is not compatible with Ballista and explodes the number of partitions (and likely causes incorrect results)
2. The query actually works fine and the final sort produces 2 rows, but the results are created by reading all the intermediate results as well
